title: What is natural science and humanities? - Quora

response.answer_text: Humanities generally study human beings, human societies, and incorporate the artistic element of humans. It’s why it includes psychology, philosophy, history, and literature. Natural science includes chemistry, biology, physics, and the other sub-disciplines like engineering and technology. Both the humanities and the natural sciences overlap. The historical method is largely empirical, psychology has biological elements, and physics has philosophical implications. Both of these two types of knowledge however have different kinds of objects and serve different purposes in our lives.
